item.title: Fall 2024 URP Applications Now Being Accepted
item.description: The Office of Undergraduate Education is currently accepting Undergraduate Research Program (URP) applications for the Fall 2024 semester! Through the URP, full- and part-time undergraduate students may pursue research for academic credit or as a paid research assistant working in the labs of world-leading Rensselaer faculty researchers during the academic year.

item.title: Covid-19 Guidance for Fall 2024
item.description: Covid-19 continues to affect our community, requiring us to adapt and change our protocols in response to evolving knowledge about the virus and changes in population immunity and susceptibility. Please read for details on what to do if you get sick, as well as prevention, testing, treatment, and other on-campus protocols.
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Being Accepted for Spring 2025 Resident Assistants
item.description: Student Living and Learning is looking for applicants to join their Spring 2025 staff. Apply now to join their team of leaders on campus and help create a community in your residence hall! Applications will be accepted from August 1 to October 4, 2024; qualified applicants will be required to attend both a group and individual interview in October. To learn more, sign up to attend an information session this Fall!

item.description: Date: Monday, September 9, 2024 5:30 PM - 7:00 PM - Join APO, Rensselaer’s co-ed service fraternity for a public service event crafting dog toys which will be donated to local pet societies!

item.title: Counseling Center Announces Walk-in Counseling Hours for Fall 2024
item.description: Rensselaer’s Counseling Center invites students to meet with a counselor without a formal appointment, during designated walk-in hours. There are two hours available for walk-in each day: (M/W/F - 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.; T/Th - 2 to 4 p.m.). Walk-in counseling is available on a first-come, first-served basis on days when classes are in session. Students who cannot attend walk-in times can call (518) 276-6479 to schedule an appointment….
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI Libraries Join PALCI Consortium
item.description: The Rensselaer Libraries are pleased to announce that they have recently joined the Partnership for Academic Library Collaboration and Innovation, or PALCI. With this membership, which replaces the Libraries’ previous ConnectNY services, Rensselaer students, faculty, and researchers will gain access to and benefit from PALCI’s extensive resource-sharing network, which includes academic and research libraries and a vast collection of over 46 million items shared by member institutions.

item.title: Volunteer for Our Bicentennial Carnival!
item.description: We are seeking volunteers to support the success of our Bicentennial Carnival on September 13 and 14, with volunteers needed from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. on both days. If you’re interested, please help us with planning by completing the volunteer form as soon as possible, and no later than Tuesday, September 10.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Schedules September 6 Info Session
item.description: Date: Friday, September 6, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and describes how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.

item.title: TLC Announces Fall 2024 Faculty/Staff Teaching and Learning Opportunities
item.description: The Teaching and Learning Collaboratory (TLC) has just announced the upcoming trainings for Rensselaer faculty and staff for the Fall 2024 term. Please be sure to visit TLC’s training page for a list of upcoming sessions, as well as their dates, times, formats, and registration links.

item.title: “Strategies on Flipping Your Course” Fac/Staff In-Person Workshop to Feature Rensselaer CS Lecturers
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Register to attend this session which will discuss the practice of moving traditional in-class lectures onto the web by creating engaging, media-rich content that students access before, during, or after class. John Sturman and Konstantin Kuzmin, both lecturers in Rensselaer’s Computer Science department, will also share their flipping/active implementations for their summer courses.

item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. item.title: HR to Hold “4 Steps to Effective Communication: Extended DISC” Professional Development Workshop
item.description:
In this workshop, participants will receive individualized Extended DISC reports (based on the completion of the Extended DISC questionnaire) that reflect both their “natural” and “adjusted” behavioral styles and learn strategies which promote successful interactions with others. Please register to attend!
